ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a ton about spanish grammar and how to write, listen, and speak in spanish.
I learned a lot of new Spanish vocabulary and grammar tenses
I didn't know any Spanish going into the course.
Grammar and speaking and listening skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A weakness of the course is that a lot of the assignments seem like busy work, prompting students to not spend much time actually digesting the information.
Strengths are that the material is taught well and the teacher was very engaging. Weakness is that it is very fast moving.

The course covers a lot of material, which is both a strength and weakness. I felt that I learned a lot, but I also feel like there wasn't enough time to thoroughly practice everything I was learning in order to actually master it.
Huge, sometimes unnecessary workload. Course packet and textbook were helpful. Wish there were more readings and longer, but less frequent, writings.
I enjoyed the course overall. I think there should be more daily practice for students to speak Spanish.
The course is very well taught, but grammatical concepts are hard to grasp because the focus on concepts only lasts 2-3 days then the course moves on.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Take this course with Juliana! She's wonderful, both as a professor and a person, and really cares about her students.
If you really want to learn spanish then yes this is the course for you.
Yes. Good class, not too stressful. Juliana was a great professor.
I would, because I think it is important to learn these specific skills in order to actually speak the language.
I would recommend it, though it is a lot of work as languages tend to be.
I think it is a good class for teaching Spanish proficiency. But there was a fair amount of busy work and less speaking in class than I had hoped. Still, overall, very enjoyable.
